The pony with the newly lit cigar flicked ash to the ground, next to the fat pony immersed in reading some scroll in a strange language a little distance away from them.

“Great,” said the mare clown. “Oh yeah, we can pick the soul willy nilly. The boiling alive thing is just for fun, and for food obviously. We decided to take you, snowball, seeing that the bat was the one who should’ve deserved to win. That’s called irony.”

“Wha-what?” stuttered Moonbounce, mouth bleeding all over the soup. “No! No! That’s not fair! That’s not fair!”

“Welcome to your new home, sweetie,” said the clown to the translucent mist that evaporated from the mare’s now limp body and vanished into the cask the pony held. After closing the container she pocketed it, and resumed adding apples into the soup.

Moonbounce kept shouting, cursing, threatening and crying while more ingredients were added, including spices, potatoes, cucumber, cream and of course salt. Little by little the brew turned thicker, while Moonbounce’s shouts turned into incoherent, ceaseless screaming. When the surface churned happily with bubbles, her eyes bulged out, mouth twisted into a horrible grimace. The clown spooned some of the soup for herself, blew on it and had a taste.

“Hmm, not bad at all. Three hours more and we’ll get excellent flavour out you.”

With that, she closed the lid on the cauldron. Not quite submerging her, it sank Moonbounce deep enough that the soup started pouring into her gaping maw, burning her from the inside too. Vegetables and roots dashed into her stomach, filling her completely with soup made mostly of herself. Her anus and pussy took in their fair share too. When the pain finally reached a lethal boundary, Moonbounce greeted it with all her heart.
121112122212222.title: It’s a race to the bottom

1211122.content:
Perhaps it was high time she started acting like a responsible guard, Moonbounce thought. Sergeant Nox was her superior after all, not to mention much more experienced in the job. Surely he had good reasons for what he did, even if those didn’t excite Moonbounce all that much. With a dutiful sigh, she headed to the quiet alleys in the tent’s proximity.

Judging from the motions of the moon, she spent a good hour cruising the cobblestones, doing her best to look innocent, lost, scared and whatever else she thought an alluring victim should look like. If nothing else, she aroused the interest of many a homeless pony and a drunk socialite on their way to the next bar. Not exactly an achievement, but at least she was assured that her figure still turned heads, even if those were not the heads she wished to be turned in particular.

Since time was a resource she had amply at her disposal, she started thinking the case. Were there really no connections between the three mares other than the obvious ones of age, sex, and looks one could objectively describe as attractive? The little file Nox had given her to read hadn’t included much information about them, save their professions (a student, a cook, and a gardener) addresses (all around the city) and pictures (attractive, like said). None of them were particularly rich. Perhaps the kidnapper knew this, which explained the lack of ransom demands. That lead to the question, what other reason there was to kidnap them. If they were indeed kidnapped.

Another strange thing about the case was how it had been handled by Sergeant Nox. Why would he choose to vest such a puzzle to a mere cadet, for whom common street patrolling represented novelty? Granted, she had chosen the case herself, but this wasn’t what she had had in mind then. All and all, the more Moon thought about her current predicament, the more reasons she could find not to like it one bit.

Immersed in her thoughts, Moon utterly failed to pay attention to the road, which resulted to a collision. An umbrella dropped, which she hurried to pick up. “Oh, sorry,” she said, hoofing the parasol back to the pony.

“It’s all well, dear,” said the stranger: a mare in her fifties, dressed in a long, laced gown stretching all the way to the ground. Moon couldn’t vouch for the impression, but she fancied recognizing her face.

“Madame Rune, I am,” said the Madame, reading the question from her lips. A shade of foreign accent shined through her low, delicate voice; a hint of Saddle-Arabia, if Moon was any judge.

Moonbounce blinked. Then the revelation struck her from the back of her mind. “Of course: Madame Rune! Sorry, I didn’t recognize you at first without your costume on. I loved your show, I really did! It wasn’t like anything I had seen before.”

“There there,” the Madame said, tapping the side of her shoe with the tip of the umbrella. “It’s not me your awe should be due, but the powers I merely serve. And if you liked it so much, please, do come again tomorrow, with a friend if you will.”

“I will, certainly,” lied Moonbounce. For the first time she looked at the other, younger mare accompanying Madame. A strange, faraway look occupied her face, as if she wasn’t fully awake. “Another awestruck fan?” Moon hazarded.

“Let us call it that,” said the Madame. She took hold of the mare by the neck, guiding her along. “Goodbye to you, dear. Hope to see you tomorrow. With a friend.”

“Bye,” said Moon, watching the two press into the night, towards the direction of the circus. In her mind, duty nagged Moon to let them be and continue the patrolling. But another trait of hers, called suspicion, voiced its contrary opinion. Ordinary as the encounter had seemed on the surface, there was something disturbing about it – especially about the forlorn mare. She had almost seemed like one of the volunteers in Madame’s circus show, which was to say, hypnotized.

A series of different paths unfolded after that observation, all leading to conclusions wilder than the one before. If this wasn’t her gut speaking, it probably couldn’t talk in the first place. Moon simply had to follow the couple. There was something to be confirmed here, although what exactly that was eluded the clarity of a proposition. That’d be the first thing she’d get clear about: of what exactly she suspected Madame guilty of.

Taking advantage of every shadow, Moonbounce tracked Madame and her escort from a safe distance. Like her initial hunch had predicted, they were heading towards the tent. At the doors Madame glanced around the clearing, as if checking nopony saw them, and then they walked in. Now that was odd, indeed.

The question was, what to do about it? Should she sneak into the tent too? Or perhaps seek out Nox, let him know what was going on. Both paths had their merits, their downsides. Either she’d ridicule herself in the eyes of the Sergeant or she’d plunge alone into possibly very real danger. And as so often before, time was not on her side.
1211122.title: Orders, right...

121113.content:
(Written by myself and Voltwrecker in an rp.)

"Let's go with-" Moonbounce began when the door suddenly flew open with a slam, somepony clearly announcing their entrance. The mare saw Nox's jaw clench and she turned around, following his eyes to the door. There stood a pure white dragony, his spaded tail waving as he flicked his two tone blue mane up. Ice blue eyes and wings matched his large eyes, slitted pupils quickly flicking between her and Nox.

Nox grunted as he looked over at the newcomer. "Sergeant Dusk, do you not understand what occupied means with regards to the meeting room?" Nox asked, his tone rather snubbish as he fixed his eyes on the dragony.

"To be honest, I half expected to find you slacking off again." The dragony stepped into the room, glancing at the door to make sure he didn't break it. Dusk was smaller than the average pony, an unfortunate side effect of the tests that had been done on him. His worth and reputation primarily came from his agility and strength, regardless of his size.

"So, is this the new recruit I'll be borrowing for the investigation?" Dusk inquired with utmost certainty, adjusting one of the straps on his pure black combat outfit. It was far less regal or refined than the guards' armour, but just as durable and much more flexible. "I trust you haven't forgotten, have you?"

Nox frowned as Dusk bit back, his tone as sharp as ever. One of these days Nox hoped the uppity test tube pony would get knocked down several pegs. At the reminder though Nox groaned. "I'd been hoping to get you out of here before he turned up, cadet," Nox informed Moonbounce quietly.

"Why?" the thestral mare replied. "He seems pretty cool," she said, admiring his outfit that made him look more like special ops than royal guard.

"Because you likely won't survive it," Nox said plainly. "Sergeant Rider takes the most dangerous of assignments... and rarely returns with his partner intact," Nox said, speaking louder so Dusk could hear him badmouthing him.

"Oh, please. Don't blame the teacher for the student's lack of talent. Try giving me someone who can keep up, then maybe I'll bring them back in one piece." He scoffed, flicking his mane again and smiling at the bat mare. "But don't worry, dear. I'll be sure to keep you safe, as long as you can keep up." He glanced at Nox. "Though if he's been your teacher, I doubt that you will. He specializes in stuffing his face and sleeping."

It was hard to see why Dusk seemed to dislike Nox so much, of course the stallions were polar opposites in most ways. Dusk was a pristine, well kept and seemingly well mannered stallion while Nox was...not exactly fitting those descriptions.

Moonbounce felt more excited than afraid as Dusk went on, talking about how he outspeeds all the other guards. She'd wanted to prove herself and this here was a big shot straight out the stable! "I can keep up!" she said confidently, snapping into a ready for action pose. She looked and seemed confident, but her overly proportioned rump and slightly tubby belly definitely made it look like Nox had been teaching her well.

Nox snorted, making a mental note to appeal to Accipiter to get Bulldozer to crush this puny ingrate at the next convenience. "Well since he's Covert Operations you don't get any choice in the matter anyway," Nox reminded Moonbounce. The thestral stallion trotted over to the desk and pulled open a drawer, lifting out a folder he had conveniently forgotten about before tossing it on the table. "Your assignment," he said, gesturing Moonbounce take a look.

Dusk nodded to her, heartened by her enthusiasm. It was rare that a recruit wanted so eagerly to go on a real mission in their first week or even their first year. Most were content to stay on patrols and guard duty while rising in the ranks and on the weight scales.

Dusk shot Nox a glare as he saw the way he was looking at him. He could tell he was plotting something, but there was a reason that his quarters had a warning on both the door and the window for, hilariously, the safety of anypony who tries to attack him.

"Go ahead, dear." He said, smiling at Moonbounce. He wasn't too much smaller than her, but when standing face to face, it would be more fitting to say face to chest.

Moonbounce smiled at Dusk, though it was weird looking down at him. He was a dragony, a superior officer, and a pretty studly stallion... but he was a little short. "I'm honoured, sir!" she said smartly, before flipping open the folder. A number of pictures came out, along with some wordy looking documents. A quick glance at the photos seemed they were mostly of a rather large and imposing mare with a scar on her cheek and a cutie mark that looked like a cartoon explosion. The next picture looked kinda like a bomb, but loaded with some glowing purple energy.

Nox rapped a hoof on the table to get her to look back up. "This is a high profile arrest. The mare, Plastique, is on so many watchlists it isn't even funny. We have documented cases of sabotage tied to her in Manehattan and Trottingham, and we have a confirmed sighting of her in Canterlot... the slums," Nox stated clearly, tapping a hoof on a small map. "We don't know how long she's been hiding here, or even where she's staying but we do know she's going to be meeting with a Diamond Dog demolitions expert who's apparently selling something exotic. This is a tier 1 threat, and you are authorised to kill her if you have to. Questions?"

Dusk already knew all that he needed to know about the mission, so he shook his head. However, he was expecting the recruit to ask questions, as she was, well...a recruit. He sat down, waiting for the inevitable barrage about 'regulations' and 'proper arrests' to come...but Moonbounce did seem a bit different from the cadets he had worked with before. She listened, but didn't seem confused or nervous...at least for now. Only time would tell if she was up to the task.

Moonbounce blinked. "So... we're hunting down a terrorist and we're allowed to kill her? Do the royal guard even do this?" she asked, looking quite taken aback.

"Covert Operations are kept covert for a reason. We don't want to incite panic. Last thing we need is ponies thinking they're being watched all the time... even though they are," Nox replied. "If your choice is kill or watch an explosion kill civilians then you kill. I know that gut of yours isn't just for show," Nox said, pointing at Moonbounce's belly and making her blush a little.

Moonbounce took a second to process that and then grinned. "Well... this is kinda cool! I like it. So do I get a cool uniform? And gadgets or..."

Nox sighed. "You're not a spy, Moonbounce. You're still a guard, and you're not Covert Ops. You have your sword if you need to use it and that's all," Nox replied straight, deflating Moonbounce a little.

This was made even more deflating by the fact that Sergeant Rider was fully decked out, a pair of goggles on the top of his head, a composite bow on his back and an odd looking gauntlet on his left front leg. He probably had other things on him as well, but perhaps this was a compliment on their part. Perhaps they figured Moonbounce was so skilled that she didn't need all of the fancy gear...while in reality Dusk was just scared of her weight breaking his equipment, which he had designed himself.

Moonbounce looked over at Dusk, expecting him to chip in, but he just gave a shrug, his equipment clearly on display. "Horseapples," Moon muttered to herself.

Nox slid the picture of the mare to Moonbounce and then closed the folder again. "Track down Plastique. The deal is going down in the Slapped Ass tavern, down on Greengate Street at midnight. It's right in the centre of the slums, which is going to be dangerous at night... especially as you're going to need to keep to the alleys as you approach so as not to tip anypony off. There isn't going to be any backup, not out there, so do not fail," he said, looking more at Dusk on that one, almost as if he expected Moonbounce to not make it back.

"Please. You know me." Dusk stood up again, stretching out and straining the suit's fabric as he flexed his limbs. The suit was designed to stretch, but it was too expensive to make a knew one after he had bulked up, so he was stuck with a tight fitting suit that made him look like a male stripper cosplaying as a SWAT pony at times. He smiled up at Moonbounce. "Shall we go? Or do you need some time to prepare?" He asked, seeming like the type to not care much either way.

Nox rolled his eyes. "Exactly," he replied straight. He whisked the folder away and chucked it into a drawer. "I'll see you when you return, Cadet. Do try to do so as you left, in one piece," he replied before trotting away, being sure to shoulder Dusk as the trotted past and out of the breifing room.

Moonbounce blinked. "Well... I guess I'm yours, Dusk!" she said, giving him a grin. "Oh I want to get out there! Spent all morning sleeping and I'm buzzed!"

Dusk shouldered right back, and despite Nox being nearly twice his size, he cracked the doorway by knocking the bulky stallion into it. "Don't push your luck." he growled, then turned back to Moonbounce.

"Right then. Let's head out. The faster we finish, the faster we get back and you get to add to your reputation. Maybe even rise up a few ranks." He smiled at her, seeming far nicer with cadets than with his fellow high ranking members.
121113.title: Enter the Dragony

choices: Ask her politely to let you past.
1211131.content:
(Written by myself and Voltwrecker in an rp.)


Moonbounce liked the sound of that. If she finished her first day as a Corporal she'd even beat her dad's record! She eagerly followed Dusk, the two setting out onto the darkened streets, moving at a quick canter all the way until they reached the divide. A small river with a bridge across marked the end of the more rich districts and the start of the slums, the difference in construction quality even clear from here. Slowly the pair trotted across, their hooves clopping on the cobbled stone as they crossed into the darker, poorer district. The magic street lamps got fewer and further between, but as a thestral low level light wasn't a probelm for Moonbounce. "So we going to stick to the alleys like Nox said?" She asked Dusk, nodding towards the dark and foreboding alley entrance nearby, which was even more threatening than the dirty poorly lit street.

"That's the best idea." Dusk nodded, starting to walk towards the entrance. Did he just...gulp? It was quite audible and Dusk's head bobbed in time with it, but surely a seasoned soldier like him wouldn't be scared. It must have just been a building creaking. Besides, he seemed to walk into the darkness with little apprehension, lighting up a strip of luminescent tubing on his legs to illuminate the alley and make it less foreboding. It was quite a long one as well, easily a hundred or more metres before the end.

Moonbounce looked at Dusk, her head twisting. "Are you okay?" she asked, seeing how he seemed almost... scared? Nah, that couldn't be it. He trotted in first, then rubbed his forelegs tofether and light rubing suddenly lit up the place, spooking some rats which ran away squeaking. The light had a blue tint and looked kinda weird, but they could see at least. "Should be a few of these alleys, right? The Slapped Ass is pretty far still," Moonbounce said as she trotted next to Dusk, her pace not slowing and forcing the smaller dragony to move a little faster than he normally would.

"Yeah. We shouldn't have to turn too much, should be a straight shot." He took a deep breath, silently sighing and calming himself. Truth be told, he was what many soldiers would call a coward. Not in the sense that he ran away from battle, but rather that he would stay at the back of the ranks or in the shadows and take out opponents that kept him in complete safety. He was not used to working with others, which was why he usually came back alone; he would often leave the cadet, complete the mission himself and return to the barracks alone.

Ahead of them, they could see a rather dirty mare behind a dumpster, half asleep but clearly drunk at the same time, an empty bottle of liquor sitting beside her. She was certainly not the skinniest, and any pony with pudge on them was one that should be treated with caution. However, the alley was wide enough for them to stay out of reach, which Dusk was already doing.

Moonbounce nodded her head. She'd been here a few times while at the Academy, but never at night. The darkness was her element though, Thestrals naturally preferring it so it wasn't a problem for her at all. She trotted alongisde Dusk, the mare not noticing him adjust his path to keep to one side of the alley. She saw where he was looking and turned herself, surprised to see a mare there. She looked filthy, and full of booze, maybe some kind of hobo. Moonbounce didn't have any change to throw and that would probably be rude anyway so she ignored her just like Dusk did.

The mare continued to sit there in her drunken stupor as the two walked past, continuing down the alley. "Trust me, that's the least dangerous kind of pony you'll find out here. Smallest, too." He grunted as they walked along, the alley becoming a bit smaller as they went further down.

As soon as the mare was out of ear shot, Dusk leaned over and and whispered to her. Moon blinked. "She was dangerous?" she asked, turning back, finding it hard to believe a grubby little hobo could be a danger... then again she did seem surprisingly well fed... "Hmm. Well, she wasn't to us at least," she replied, shrugging as the pair of them passed into a smaller, tighter alleyway.

"That's not a good way to look at things. Anything is a danger in the slums." As he said 'slums', his voice cracked a bit, but surely that was just an accident.

Dusk suddenly stopped, holding out a hoof to stop Moonbounce as well. Ahead of them was a much larger mare than the last, this time standing directly in their path with her back facing them. The two could hear loud slurping and gulping noises, the mare assumedly scarfing down some scraps of food she found. She shone gently in Dusk's artificial light, the sweat on her fur shining gently. Her stomach hung low, lower than Moonbounce's, who in comparison was about three quarters of the mare's size.
1211131.title: Alleyway Adventurer

12111311.content:
(Written by myself and Voltwrecker in an rp.)


Moonbounce was finding it a bit hard to stomach, but then she heard that voice crack again. Dusk was scared. Scared of the slums... of these ponies. Maybe they really were dangerous... Just as she thought about it a hoof pushed out in front of her and she walked into it, the leg squishing into her belly. She opened ehr mouth to speak then saw the mare. This one was big, big enough to fit Dusk inside her swollen, sagging gut. She was loudly scarfing something, which had Dusk spooked. She saw him sneaking off to the side... and decided maybe that would be the smart thing to do. She tried to sneak past the other side of the mare, away from Dusk's lights.

Dusk smartly turned off his lights to avoid startling the mare, his eyes still glowing gently in the darkness. He slipped by easily, but unfortunately, Moonbounce did not get by without attracting attention. The mare turned to her, her eyes locking onto the thestral and stepping in front of her to block her path. "What're y'all doin' here, prissy bitch?" she immediately opened with a foul mouthed insult, snarling. Dusk paused, waiting to see what would happen.

Moonbounce edged in the darkness, but the swaying of her chubby flanks was enough motion to catch the mare's eyes. Suddenly the large dirty looking mare was right in her face. "O-official guard business! Please stand aside!" Moonbounce retorted puffing up her chest and trying to look important, while her eyes looked for Dusk to come help.

"Y'all're guards? That makes ya twice as tasty!" She laughed, rearing up on her hind legs and pinning Moonbounce to the floor, expertly removing her chest armour. It was clear she had experience in this, as she had the piece off in seconds and was already running her disgusting, slimy tongue up and down her bare chest.

Dusk sighed, tipping his head in a half-hearted bow before firing his grappling hook onto a nearby roof, letting the winch pull him up as he vanished over the edge.

Moonbounce expected the mare to treat her with respect, but instead she was shoved to the floor, her armour wrenched off in an instant and tossed aside. The huge, hungry mare leaned down, slurping over Moon's chest as the mare let out a sudden cry. "N-No! No! You can't eat me! Help!" she squealed, looking for Dusk. She saw his tail whipping away and vanishing onto the rooftops, then looked back to see the mare's slimy jaws right above her. "Get off of me!" she yelped as she tried to shove the larger mare off with her hooves.

Not bothering with the golden boots or anything else, the mare opened her mouth wide, her drool dripping from her lips onto Moonbounce's face. Before anything could be said or done, she had already engulfed the smaller mare's head in her jaws, her rancid breath washing over Moonbounce as she moaned and licked all over her head, savouring the flavour of clean, fresh pony meat.

As her purple boots clashed against the mare's chest, the mare decided to just start dinner. Moonbounce squealed and pulled back but her head was shoved forwards, crammed into the drooling, hot maw as lips clapped around her shoulders. She heard a moan over her flavour as nasty, horrible breath filled her nostrils and the tongue bathed her in sticky mess. "Let me out!" she squealed desperately, flailing her body, her tasty looking rump bouncing up and down.

The mare was eager to finish her off quickly, having been hankering for a wriggling meal for days. She swallowed heavily, the one pulse of her muscles pulling Moonbounce in past her shoulders, chest and even halfway past her stomach. The mare was panting, her marehood beginning to ache from the sensation of devouring another pony. She'd have to find a stallion around after she was done.

Moonbounce's wriggles only sped up the swallowing, gulps and slurps dragging her deeper, her shoulders squeezing inside, followed by her belly, quickly reaching her waist. A clear bulge of her face and forehooves was already pushing out against the mare's bloating gut as the large shaped bulge of her midsection had the mare's throat nice and wide. The plump thestral butt and wriggling legs was all that remained of the guardsmare who wouldn't even make it to her first assignment, snatched up on the way by a hungry mare.

The mare wormed her tongue between the plump, doughy cheeks, and in most cases, a mare like her would have been jealous of such a perfectly round rump, but giving her own ass a smack she reminded herself that she was far more endowed than some prissy guard. Another swallow sent her ass packing down her throat, followed by her legs and finally her hooves slid down and her lips clapped shut behind her, her tongue slowly coming out to run over her lips and grab the last bits of sweat and flavour she could get.

Moonbounce let out a moan as the mare tongued her sensitive ass cheeks, the soft mounds vaguely tasting of apple, but much sweeter and the pudge was just the right level to be delicious without being too fatty. She stole some nibbles before the swallow carried the ass downwards, and then those legs in long slurps. Hooves wriggled for a second, shoes falling off to expose soft Thestral soles for a second before they were slurped up too. A loud gulp echoed as the mare licked her lips, and her huge belly sagged with the entirety of the mare guard, Moonbounce already starting to struggle and scream harder, begging to be let go as she jiggled the belly with her kicks.

Immediately after her stomach was filled, the mare's lips were fluttering once more as a rancid belch erupted from her gullet, carrying with it several grey feathers and one purple, saliva coated boot. She giggled to herself, licking her lips again before standing up and beginning to walk away, her stomach sloshing and jiggling uselessly beneath her. Moonbounce would never see the light of day again, that was certain.

Dusk looked back as he heard the colossal belch erupt from behind him, a soft blush spreading across his face. A shame...he did have a thing for pudgy mares, but he also had a thing for living. Besides, he had plenty of mares fawning over him back at the barracks.

Moonbounce knew she wasn't as sneaky as Dusk, and there wasn't much space for her to fit in. The guardspony instead stood up a little taller and trotted forwards, stopping behind the large mare. "Excuse me?" she called up to her. When the mare turned slightly Moonbounce would smile. "Would you mind moving out of the way please? I've got to get to the Slapped Ass," she said, thinking nothing of the name drop, and the reputation that place had.

Under normal circumstances, the mare would have just sat down and crushed the guard, but hearing where she was going...she figured she would face a much worse fate there. Giving an exasperated grunt, she stepped to the side, pulling with her the greasy bag of some kind of fried food and continuing to eat whatever it was.

Moonbounce smiled. "Thanks!" she said cheerily before trotting past, paying no mind to the mare as she trotted past, Dusk staring at her in shock as she announced her position and didn't end up drooping out a sagging gut. She could hear the mare munching behind as she carried on down the straight path.

Dusk shook his head, figuring this cadet wasn't even going to make it all the way to the Slapped Ass. The two exited the alley, finally, and found themselves on a dirt road leading to the center of town. From here, they could either continue to wind their way through alleyways fraught with danger, or they could take a straight shot down to the Slapped Ass, while risking the chance of being discovered. Dusk seemed indifferent, so the decision was up to Moonbounce.

Moonbounce shrugged at Dusk's head shake. "She was just minding her own business! Can't assume everypony's dangerous," she said, only making Dusk shake his head more. They emerged from the alley and they could see the tavern down a straight street, the image of a donkey gettings its ass slapped with a hoof proudly on a sign at the top. 12111312.title: A Simple Request

Moonbounce stopped suddenly and Dusk ended up ramming muzzle first into her butt, his snout squeezing into her crack and startling her as she let out an eek and a burst of spicy gas ripped from her butt and right into his face. While Dusk recovered, the stallion thrust his hips forward and the sobs became even more muffled, the stallion's grunts and moans getting louder as he moved his hoof up and down.

Moonbounce looked back to see Dusk coughing and choking against a wall, trying to get rid of her butt fumes. To distract herself from that fact... as well as out of moral obligation... she cantered forwards. "E-exucse me, everything all right over there?" she asked, addressing the pair of stallions as it sounded quite... problematic.

That flower bud looked so perfect... she couldn't help but lean down and take a heavy snort. Just a sniff and she would leave...

She got frosting up her nose, and the sudden agitation seemed to make the flower somehow twitch before it rose. The flower seemed to suddenly press into Moonbounces face, and then spread somehow. The flower of frosting was sudden over her head as she would fail to see the cake rising. A laugh breaking the air as the cake mare rose up forcing the muzzle right into the crack.

"Gotcha~ Only took a few tries but I finally got you in just the right place alone," a voice stated, seeming to come from the cake.

Moonbounce got the scent of frosting as drops of it flicked into her nose. The flower bud before her twitched, and then it pushed back. Her amber eyes went wide as the flower of the cake pushed back and spread over her face, a loud slurp carrying it around her muzzle and to her neck. She gasped as her breath was suddenly full of Cake... and butt. What was happening?! "Mmmphh!" she protested, raising her hooves to try and push the cake when she heard a voice... what was happening? Who was talking?!

Her body was against a rather soft and squishy interior of something, alongside a heavy smell of baked goods and enough sugar to give her diabetes. She was suddenly pulled upward as the cake pony grunted to start pulling her into her rump. The interior made somewhat more of dough than cake at the point she was at.

Moonbounce flailed as she felt something pull her deeper, dragging her into something. Even though it smelled delicious and sweet, she knew that something very bad was happening. Her muzzle pushed between the cheek-like mounds of cake, and into the bud, pressing deeper and deeper as the rim slipped over her head, squeezing her into a doughy passage as she struggled and cried out in muffled yells.

"Finally gotcha~" The cake pony said as her stomach soon sat bloated and full on the desk. She pressed her frosted gut happily enjoying the full feeling hoping she could get out of the dangerous guard nest soon.

Moonbounce had no idea who wanted to eat her and why, but it was clearly happening. Her slightly pudgy belly squeezed in between those two cake cheeks, her own bouncing butt soon following as it was squeezed tight into the buds. Her hind legs kicked and wrigged, trying to pull herself out as the Cake pony draped across the chest, her huge belly bouncing and wriggling with the form of her prey, muffled screams coming from within.

"Good good good~ you feel nice and lively~" The cake pony pressed down more against her belly, enjoying herself more and more. She even felt herself leak a little butter cream at the enjoyable sensation.

Wriggling thestral legs squeezed together, pushing against one another as they were slurped up into the bud, dragged inside in an instant. Only her hooves remained for a second, wriggling in place, feeling cream leaking over them before a pop claimed them both. Her attempts to struggle pushed the imprint of hooves and a muzzle out against the stomach, causing it to stretch outwards in that spot as the guardspony fought for her life against the cake trap.

"Bad !" The cake mare said, suddenly pressing on her gut. "You are ruining my frosted coat," she said as she tried to force her down.

Hooves mashed against the bulge that Moonbounce made, the belly wall squeezing inwards under the hoof and against the Thestral. "No! Please! Don't digest me! I'm not Accipiter!" she screamed, fighting to be heard over the gurgling gut and muffling.

"What?" the cake pony cried incredulously as her head shot up. "Then who the buck are you? Why are you in his office!" She demanded as she pressed on her gut hard to threaten her meal. Though there were few that would shout that out suddenly at the realization of what was going on.

Moonbounce heard the voice finally twist and she opened her mouth to speak when the cake mare shoved down hard. There was a loud squelch and Moonbounce splattered into the acids, the hard squeeze ending her much too quickly... and robbing the cake mare of any more answers, just leaving her with a large and sloshing belly of mystery mare.

"Great...." Cake mare said as she rolled onto her back. It would take a bit for her bely to shrink back down, and she had a high chance of being caught with her stomach gurgling away in there. She pressed it as the bat pony was reduced to dough and a sigh.

Moonbounce was a mass of dough, ready to be reshapen as she sloshed about in that gurgling stomach, the cake mare's belly much too big for her to curl back up again. Her hooves sank into the stomach, pushing and squeezing it as she tried to compact the remains, and not end up getting discovered...

She pressed even thinking of trying to press her stomach into a book if it would work. She just needed to get it shrunken, or at least emptied. "Stupid gut... can't even rush this out," she said with a grumble.

Moonbounce left plenty of mush... very inconvenient mush that her stomach steadily processed. All the gurgling and glorping working her down, melting her into a big load of chocolatee to drop. Even though she grumbled her pats and squeezes were working... though where she should dump them out was a problem.

"Maybe just back on the plate..." the cake pony suggested. She could slip out afterward hopefully and figure out something. She felt her stomach starting to compact finally at least. The pony within no longer even recognizable.

Her belly still refused to compact completely... but it was reducing in size. Even though it still gurgled she could feel some of the rich chocolate already pushing back against her rear. She could squeeze it as she digested if she really strained, the benefit of a powerful, predatory system designed for ponies.

She pressed. Her stomach acid was actually a rther thick frosting, much like everything else about her. She wanted to be done and to get out of there. She heard a pony pass outside and stopped moving, glad that it seemed to have gone. It took several more minutes before the gurgling stopped, only a steady slosh remaining from the liquified remains inside her gut, the mare guard mushed up into chocolate mulch, ready to be released. She rolled onto her gut so she could unload the second her rear was ready to.

The cake mare's rear parted with a loud burst of gas... and then a squishy squelchy sound as a thick brown lump of chocolate squeezed out of her flower bud, sliding between frosted cheeks and then falling onto the clean plate with a loud splat, leaving a steaming, almost spherical ball of chocolate waste. Her gut made a groaning noise, and she knew there was a lot more coming. Pressing her gut to the floor, she squeezed down, compacting all she had eaten back and towards her still parted tailhole as a second lump was already squeezing her way out of her.

She grunted loudly, forcing back as her back legs quivered slightly from the force she was pushing with her bowels. With another splat a second ball of chocolate fell, and then a third, none giving her relief as she just wanted to be done with this idiotic pony that had taken the trap meant for her target. A third and fourth sweet lump splatted down into the growing heap in swift succession, each flattening out a little as they piled on top of one another.

The sudden sound of hooves had her freeze in place. She held her breath, not daring to move a muscle, a squishy brown clump of waste dangling from her rear, lightly wobbling to and fro as she held still, waiting until the hooves passed. The second they were out of hearing again she relaxed, the chocolate making another moist splat as it hit the plate, followed swiftly by a series of others.

The hot and steaming pile of mush was missing something, and her twinging marehood had an idea. She let it loose, sighing as a spray of sweet, frosted drizzle squeezed from her marehood, splashing over the heap, giving a light icing decal to the top of each one as she sighed in relief. Soon she was done and she turned back with a smile, looking back at the plate of brownies that now sat on the desk instead.

She jumped down and looked to the door, she unlocked it at the least. She would need to sneak out, and replan things. At the least there was one less guard to potentially deal with if she had the wrong target.

Accipiter would soon enough discover the plate of brownies and find them quite delicious. Compliments were made to the baker... Moonbounce's contribution just as much appreciated as unknowing as it was. At least she foiled an assassination plot... but sometimes the cake actually is a lie.
12331.title: Moonbounce Gets Brownie Points

12332.content:
(This chapter was done in rp between myself and Dudey64.)

The cake was just too much. This was Accipiter's office, a well known hardass... why would he have a cake like this? No... this had to be some kind of prank cake. Moonbounce couldn't risk poison joke again... last time she'd almost ended up crushed under her own building sized butt cheeks... It had taken a lake of antidote to clear that up. She shuddered at the memory, it more than enough to put her off the cake. Instead she backed up into the hallway once more, and set her sights ahead. Somewhere in theis building there would be food.

Another five minutes of trotting and Moonbounce's belly was physically groaning. She was so hungry now... all this thought of food had her starving. The grey thestral's purple armour clad hooves clopped against the floor. She passed an open doorway, glancing inside and at a stallion mopping... then she suddenly stopped mid-step. There was something about this stallion that made her just completely stop her trot. She blinked to herself and her belly grumbled again and she realised what it was... he looked delicious...

Mint idly swished the mop to and fro, leaving trails of soppy water on the ground in an attempt to keep the ground looking clean. A task ultimately pointless as most guards simply prodded around without cleaning their hooves after their patrols, making the task a little pointless. Despite this he dutifully swayed his hips to the movement, his long mint green tail trailing after him. He noticed that somepony was nearby and raised for a friendly wave, not expecting much back from most guards as janitorial duty usually meant you were going to be the butt of jokes.

Moonbounce stared transfixed for a moment, her amber eyes focusing on those swaying hips, that long green tail teasingly rising from the floor and up to a tight rump. She realised she was salivating and wiped her mouth with a hoof just as he noticed her. She rose a hoof back and returned the wave, before stepping through the doorway and into the room. She'd heard about janitor duty, seemed Mint must have fallen out with some officer over something. Most of the Celestial guard were out on patrol, and the Lunar guard asleep, so there was almost nopony around other than the two of them. Moonbounce shut the door, making sure it clicked into place before she turned back to him. "How's the cleaning going?"

Mint was pleasantly surprised to have somepony to talk to, "Well, it's the same as usualy. Clean the grounds and scrub whatever mess somepony left behind. You wouldn't want to know what that can be sometimes..." He shuddered and stood against his mop for a bit looking at her quizically, "Hey, aren't you part of the night guard? I thought most of you would be sleeping by now."

Moonbounce nodded her head. "Yeah, yeah, I can imagine. Some of those guards are pretty..." she led off there with a shudder, picturing a particularly massive mare she'd seen wondering around who somehow turned battle dress into a thong with the size of her ass. Then again... this stallion could make a nice big mess when her body was done with him. She almost drooled at the thought again, her belly groaning loud enough to be heard. "Oh, uh, yeah! I'm just hungry, looking to chow down before I sleep."

He raised his eyebrows, "O-oh, well, you'll either have to wait till lunch or head out to get something, I'm not sure what'll be served though. I don't have anything on me to offer." He clutched the mop and began swishing again to clean up some grime. "I hope you don't mind, but I have a lot of ground to cover or I'll get in trouble. It'll just be a few more hours, I'll probably be there to so we could probably have a meal together." With that he gave her a friendly nod and continued with his duties.

Yeah... I know, heh," Moonbounce replied. It wasn't a fact she was very happy about. She didn't fancy a walk across town, well not alone anyway. The stallion was still mopping at the floor, wiping away a very odd stain that looked almost orange. "It'll probably be something boring again. The chefs don't have a lot of imagination," Moonbounce added with a shrug. The stallion seemed to notice the conversation going nowhere from his response. "Well, uh, sure. We could meet up for lunch," she replied. The stallion went back to his duties and Moonbounce turned and trotted back to the door, opening it up. She looked back at Mint, noticing his back was turned now. Could she really eat another guard just to fill her belly? Maybe she should just go out and find some place to eat.

123321.content:
(This chapter was done in rp between myself and Dudey64.)

Moonbounce sighed, her belly still groaning. She couldn't eat another guard; even if he looked and smelled so delicious... no, no, she'd have to find somewhere open. It shouldn't be too hard. The thestral let out a puff of air in annoyance before she left Mint alone with the click of a shut door. She was back in the hallways, though it didn't take long to reach the entrance from there. She nodded at a couple of guards near the door before walking out between them and out into the city. Canterlot definitely had a lot of good food... along with its fair share of danger, but who would touch a guard?

Out in the radiant sunlight, the thestral found herself squinting, a leathery wing unfolding to try and cover her eyes from the burning late morning sun. She quickly burst into a canter to push to some shade where she stopped with a sigh of relief. Her stomach was quick to grumble again though, she needed something to eat! A small snack stall near the barracks caught her eye that had to be where most of the guards grabbed a bite on the way back from patrol. Greasy fryers were visible from where she stood, though other than a seemingly massive stall with a cushion, the only sign of the owner was a piece of paper helpfully stating "Be right back". The stall was easily opened up though... and no one was really looking. Slipping back there and starting up the fryers would be a breeze.

Just down the road though a new restaurant had opened up a few weeks ago. It seemed to be open for early lunches and late breakfasts. It was expensive, but apparently the food was to die for. Who would have thought dragons would make good gourmands? There wasn't a queue at the moment, she could easily grab a table and then order to her hearts content.
123321.title: Being the Good Guy... and Going Hungry

choices: What was that? Suspicious activity warrants investigation!
All you can eat buffet? You can eat a lot, could they really live up to that?
1233211.content:
(This chapter was done in rp between myself and Dudey64.)

Moonbounce was a guard... she reminded herself of it for the third time. That meant no stealing cake, no eating guards, and no breaking into snack stalls. She fished around in her pocket and found her first pay packet. That could probably get her something nice. She smiled and trotted towards the restaurant. "The Gourmand Grotto: a five star Draconic Dining Delight" was proudly written on a large sign above what almost seemed like a cave entrance. A metal portcullis kept just anyone from walking in, a young adult dragon twice Moonbounce's size smiled down at her. "Welcome. We are currently serving brunch. Table for one?" the female dragon chirped excitedly.

"Please!" Moonbounce replied, feeling the enthusiasm. The gate groaned open and she was waved inside, stepping into a cave that would be pretty dark if not for the gleaming gems embedded in the walls. Artificial lights reflected off of the dazzling sapphires, rubies and emeralds to cast a multi-coloured rainbow of beautiful light. The other patrons might still have trouble seeing, but the eyes of a thestral had no problem with the dark. She was led to a small table hewn out of rock and seated on a comfortable and very smooth boulder. Her plump grey flanks spread out across the seat as she sighed, then looked for a menu.

As she looked over the menu she could see various other ponies, Zebra's and gryphons either ordering or enjoying their meals as well as a few dragons that wandered about serving guests. In the far corner of the restaurant a was a carved out opening shielded by gem covered curtains from where dragons entered and left with meals covered by a silver dome, the meals dousing her in fresh scents of deliciously prepared meals and a cool wind blowing through tunnels in the restaurants ceiling.

On the menu there was an option for an all you can eat buffet as a celebration of some kind, this seemingly a very lucky day to wander in. Besides that were some regular pony meals and special dragon meals to choose from, unsurprisingly either containing meat or gems.

So many delicious things were hinted at in the menu, this place most definitely specialising in meat, and what delicious smelling meat it was. The waiters seemed to thread between tables on purpose, carrying huge silver trays that wafted the enticing scent of spices and meat, melded into a luxurious and no doubt sumptuous dish. She almost got up and followed one heading to a nearby table full of eager zebras. The promise of an all you could eat meal was one that her licking her lips and prodding her totally empty stomach. Enough meat and she wouldn't have to eat for weeks.

Just out of sight however and deep in the darker, unlit corner of the cave was another opening covered by curtains that weren't entirely shut and as the breeze blew through a little more causing it to become more visible. In the darkness could be made out a draconic shape that wandered by pulling a moving sac by a rope, the suspicious activity well hidden in the darkness.
1233211.title: Dining Above Your Pay Grade

She needs to go back and get backup.

12332111.content:
(This chapter was done in rp between myself and Dudey64.)

Moonbounce couldn't focus on dining now! Something caught her eye... something she couldn't ignore. In the darkness her keen eyes spotted movement, a curtain blowing open and showing behind it a squirming and struggling sack. Rope tied it to the claws of a dragon who was clearly lugging it along, from a back entrance and what looked like towards the kitchens. If it was something shady it was her duty as a guard to investigate. She stood up, making it look like she was heading for the toilets but veering off at the last second and slipping behind the curtain, keen to follow the sack and find out what was up.

The hallway was dark and only dimly lit by the very far spaced gems that lined the walls at natural seeming heights. There were no signs or any furniture as it seemed to round about the edge of the restaurant. A slight incline brought it close to an area just above where the kitchen seemed to be. She heard a few muffled groans from the bag, whatever was inside moved slowly, seemingly tired.

The dragon pushed open a fake wall and stepped through into a rather large room containing some kind of box with an opening, a few tables and what seemed like cooking utensils lined along a wall.

The dragon huffed for a moment before tossing the sack onto a table and opening it up to reveal a bound pony. The pony moved about sluggishly, their face inching aside as the dragon looked them over before tossing it onto their back and proceeding into another room. There was the sound of some shuffling, possibly other dragons and some metallic clangs.

Moonbounce looked around, this corridor even darker. Dragons must have pretty good dark vision too... makes sense given them living in caves and all. Gems seemed to act as torches, the fires higher than Moonbounce was tall as she gazed between the two walls. There was nothing here, just a featureless corridor that circled around from the back entrance to the kitchens near the front... a secret entrance perfect for some illegal activities. Her eyes flicked at a groan from the bag, it moving in a way that most bags would most definitely not. There had to be an equine inside.

Suddenly the dragon stopped, seeming to take note of a gem that was a slightly different colour. With a push it slotted into the wall, and the wall slid open revealing some kind of secret room. Moonbounce's eyes went wide, then even wider as the sack was tossed onto a table and opened up. The canvas fell away, and a pony was revealed, a grey earth pony mare with a two toned green mane. She looked pretty rough already as she was hauled up and carried through a side entrance in the secret room and off to another room. Moonbounce could hear the sound of dragons grunting and clanging metal from beyond and she swallowed. It would be difficult to follow that dragon deeper. She chewed her lip a little, pondering her next move.

123321111.content:
With a brisk trot Moonbounce rushed through the secret entrance and into the small room. She looked around it in detail, seeing the variety of knives, basters and pans so big that even she could fit inside them. This was all pretty damning evidence already... what was that box though. She peered inside, nose wrinkling at a sulphurous stink inside. Her ears flicked at the sound of something returning. With a split second to think she tossed herself into the box, diving inside the hole to get out of sight.

The curtain opened up to reveal a few dragons, the one from before walking back out of the room as the other two, dressed in apron and chef's hat set about preparing various objects and setting them aside. One of the dragons walked up to the box only to glance at the other for a moment and ask whether things had been prepared before. The dragons looked at the secret door that had just shut and shrugged, thinking that they had already put something in the box and one set about chopping up vegetables from a sac that they brought and another went about on a table to her side.

The dragons hummed something under their breath, their tunes being accompanied by grumblings that came from their abdomens and after a short time of waiting one of the dragons stepped up to the box and turned around, presenting their rear to the small view hole in the box and with only a grunt of a warning a warm draft of pungent smoke wafted into the box as a warm, almost singing breeze that smelled heavily of egg and sulphur,-brrrooomph-. The dragon let out a happy sigh as they returned back to chopping just moments before the other rubbed their abdomen and began their approach to the hiding spot.

Moonbounce watched as a group of dragons returned, most of them wearing aprons and silly chef hats. This had to be some kind of kitchen. So this was the secret kitchen... probably where they prepared ponies... but where was the oven? Where was the spit? How did they cook ponies? All they had was this strange... box... oh. Moonbounce suddenly began to sweat. Was she in the oven? There wasn't any heat. She heard the dragons talking idly, their voices hard to make out. One of them seemed to start chopping vegetables... hardly a terrifying image. The others all milled around, their bellies groaning about something.

One of them split from the others and stepped over to the box. Moonbounce shifted back, sliding away from the view hole when suddenly it was filled by ass. A pair of sweaty and scaly cheeks squishing back against it as a pulsating pucker trembled between. What were they...? The sudden eruption of flatulence had her eyes widen, and then slam shut as the air hit her. It wasn't just warm; it was hot, very hot. Like being blown by a hairdryer that someone was blowing past a bowl of rotten eggs. She gagged at the stink, an edge of manure making her retch a little when she saw two more dragons approaching. Should she scream?
123321111.title: Out of the Kitchen and Into the Oven

1233211112.content:
(This chapter was done in rp between myself and Dudey64.)

Moonbounce held her breath. She couldn't let them know she was here... a guard in the kitchen. She'd be taken out for sure. She just had to sit still and outlast their gassy butts. Surely they'd stop eventually, give a window for her to escape.

The dragon wandered up to the oven and smirked at the opening, not being able to make out the pony that was inside or really caring as they turned about and pressed their large rump into the opening, letting out an audible moan as the scaly pucker bulged out and released a toasty rush of air -braaapt- that clouded the oven even more, the small area beginning to grow in heat more rapidly as the dragon swayed its hips from side to side letting out a few more toots before pulling its cheeks away and leaving a sweaty sheen on the ovens opening before wandering back to the vegetables.

An audible chuckle was heard as the dragons conversed with one another, the first walking up to the ovens opening and chuckling with its rump aimed at the oven, ready to slam it back.

Moonbounce saw dragon fangs, a sharp smile pointed right at her. She didn't see any eyes... but they knew something was in there... This wasn't good. This dragon's ass made the first look petit, those huge cheeks not even visible as all she could see was ass crack, and that huge gaping butthole. It quaked, already bulging outwards before it ripped a hot and rancid blast, the air turning visible green as it pumped into the oven, filling the air with stink. The metal panels that lined the box began to glow slightly, absorbing the heat and keeping it going as small toots puffed against Moon's face. There was a wet slurp as the asshole pulled away, leaving her be for a second, sweat dripping from the oven, but already another ass was sliding in front of the door. Moonbounce whimpered as this was going to only get worse.

The ass gave her little time to think as they erupted with a foul blast almost immediately, its owner laughing loudly as the stream of toasty vapours poured into the small confines and it became boiling hot, the air causing her hairs to stand on end and slowly peel with the tremendous concentrated stench that had swept away almost anything breathable from the oven.

A quack sounded just beyond the cheeks and they were pushed aside as a second rear smooshed into it, both rears now aimed at the opening as one of the dragons that seemed to protest pushed them away as both giggled loudly.

Moonbounce felt her own armour amplifying the heat and desperately stripped it off, sliding off her breastplate and kicking off her shoes, tossing them into a corner away from her just as the third ass hit. Another dirty bassy trumpet of stink ripped into the box... but this one was so much hotter. It rushed inside, kicking the cold air out and replacing everything with that stink. Moon felt her throat dry, her belly sweat... and then her fur start to fall away. Her eyes went wide as she tried to clasp it in place with her hooves, but it was all over her. Her sweaty, doughy body was heating up; her skin starting to burn and chafe, and her fur was falling out. She had to get out now. "W-wait," she croaked, her voice quiet and dry.

The smashing of asses drowned her out as she tried to call for help, to get them to back off, but now two asses were smooshed in her path, both pointed right at her as their owners giggled. Moon could only whimper.

The dragons both bored down, their puckers bulging outwards and glistening with sweat in the reflected colours of the gems. As if practiced both rings opened up in tandem, -frrrrrrt- -brrromfff- a visible cloud of filth streaming directly into the hole, the combined stink rancid enough to rob a skunk of its breath and the heat so searing that it made the opening seemingly wobble, the area oven around her now clinging to the heat as wherever she touched the oven the heat tugged at her skin.

The air was now as good as unbreathable, the unrelenting asses taking turns in releasing plumes of rear exhaust into the small box and shortly after one of them laughed and looked inside before closing the small opening as they both went back to preparing the meal.

The air only got hotter and hotter, Moonbounce having a second to take in those thick, sweaty dragon puckers before they pulled apart in a joint duet of horrible, nasty flatulence. The combined stink and heat earned a dry scream from Moonbounce, the oven filling with the utterly horrific gas, the air so unbreathable she felt like she was blacking out. With a flop she fell onto her back, her own ass visible inside the hole as her skin began to brown, her fur long gone as the scorching dragon gas roasted her in that hot box.

For a brief second the lid opened and a dragon looked down at her to laugh, seeing the thestral's browning skin, her desperate eyes, and maybe even noticing the guard armour in the corner. It was much too late for Moonbounce, just one more blasting like that and she'd pass out permanently for sure.

The opening remained closed for a short while, the broiling heat remaining constant and cooking her slowly through the surrounding suffocating air. After some time the opening opened up again only for one of the familiar cheeks to squish into it and release a deadly blast of stink towards her -bbrrraapt-. The dragon stepped away with a small sigh before closing the lid once more and dousing her in the silence of the heat singing oven around her.

There was just enough air to keep Moonbounce's brain whirring, but her body weak and heavy. Her buns grilled, the scent of her own roasting ass filling her nostrils along with the rest of her. She could feel her fat hardening, her pudgy belly going still and roasting up. Her eyes were barely open when she heard a noise, looking up, praying it was Nox come to save her... instead it was just another dragon butt. The ass cheeks filled the hole and let rip with one long and gassy concerto, a fart that went on for seconds, building and falling as stink and heat filled Moonbounce. When the ass finally pulled free and the door shut, the mare went still with a last twitch, Moonbounce well on her way to becoming a five star dining experience.

The dragons continued with preparing the meal, idly chopping away and mixing condiments for the meal. Every once in a while a dragon would walk over to the oven and open the lid, pressing their rump against it and letting out a happy sigh as a muffled fart resounded in the small space before closing it off.

After about an hour of cooking one of the dragons walked up to the oven and opened it up, waving away the visible cloud of stench that rolled out before reaching in and pulling out the bottom on which the now nicely browned skin of the pony rested on. Her armour clattered to the side, glowing with heat, but the second dragon simply picked it up and tossed it aside, not paying it much attention as they went about placing her in a pleasing position and pouring the condiment mixes over her and smearing it out finely with a brush, surrounding her with a bed of vegetables and other smaller meats. They stretched her mouth open, the seared flesh tearing at the edges as it opened with a meaty sound before an apple was stuffed in.

Once done both dragons looked down at the dish with a smile, one picking it up and walking down a small flight of stairs and entering a sectioned off VIP area that was filled with a small few very fancily dressed ponies and larger dragons.

12332111121.content:
(This chapter was done in rp between myself and Dudey64.)

Prince Blueblood was idly watching a female dragoness scrubbing a table, her generously plump and sweaty flank wobbling and bouncing about with each swaying of her body. He licked his lips, almost missing the waiter approaching until his platter was dumped in front of him and onto the table. The lid lifted off and the Prince almost drowned on his own saliva. "Truly tremendous... now I see why auntie was so happy to give you the money you needed to set up shop," Blueblood remarked, giving a wide smile to the draconic waiter. "Mmm... I feel like a good Coche-Dury Corton-Charlemagne Grand Cru to wash down this... where did you even find a Thestral?"

The waiter shrugged and Blueblood just waved him off to fetch his wine. Now it was just him and his meal alone, he turned her around, wanting to face a sumptuous looking roasted ass over her face, licking his lips in delight as it was perfectly coated in sauce. The vegetables and meats were basically plating, this was the real delight. His horn glowed as he levitated the roasted pony up, shoving her hind hooves into his jaws and then slurping up to the butt, taking his time to gulp and slurp at her saucy cheeks, exploring holes and moaning at the flavour as his throat bulged wider, the stallion slowly swallowing and tossing his head back like a pelican, taking his time with this meal.

Blueblood managed to just about work his jaw around his meal, the almost apple flavour to the mare's meat adding another complex note to the already scrumptious meal. Her rear finally slipped into his jaws as her heated pussy released his tongue, just in time for it to slurp her pudgy gut. The thestral had a lot of meat to her, far more than the usual scrawny fare on the flying ponies, it made sense they charged so much for a meal like this, though money was no concern to a Prince. His lips smacking around her gut, compacting and squeezing it, slowly dragging it inside inch by inch as his tongue played briefly with her naval.

The dragoness who had been cleaning tables trotted past, and Blueblood didn't miss the opportunity to pinch her ass, making her squeal as he laughed around his huge meal, then settled back into swallowing. At this point his jaws were actually getting a little tired so he sped up, squeezing and squishing her mass of stomach until with a last gulp it was bulging out his throat so it was wider than his head. Her shoulders reached his lips and he swallowed over them, and lastly came the head. He worked his jaws over her, pointing her muzzle up so as her snout slipped into his jaws, his teeth clamped together and caught the apple, holding it in his mouth as he swallowed down the mare, a last few gulps dumping the roasted pony into his belly.

A loud crunch came from the apple as he took a bite, then lifted it out of his maw... before a massive UUURRRRRPPPP tore from his Princely jaws, echoing through the cavern. With no regard for the rest of his meal he let his hooves rest in the mixture of expensive meats and rare plant salad, simply waiting for the waiter to arrive with a bottle of wine for him to uncork and guzzle greedily. A pat of his stomach earned another belch and a grin. "Lovely stuff. Compliments to the chef," he told the waiter as his hoof patted the swollen sphere of mare meat that was his stomach. 1233211122.content:

Moonbounce was still dazed, the clearly Lunar guard caught off guard by the door. Her spinning head made out another big dragon as he glared down at her. Her eyes went wide as she readied to scream when a huge foot crashed down onto her. With a squelch her rump was flattened down, causing its gassy payload to rip all over Moonbounce, the thestral coughing in her own gas. The claw squeezed hard and then came the threat, the massive dragon pinning her down definitely enough to get her to bite her tongue and nod. There'd be a better opportunity... and not when a sweaty, scaly sole was grinding mucky filth into her butt fur.

The dragon pressed into her sizable flanks a few more times with a pleased grin on its face before it reached down and grabbed a hold of her hind hooves. It pulled her along the long hallway, stealing a quick glance at her occasionally to bare its teeth at her. "I don't know what you're doing here, but the boss doesn't pay too kindly to mice." It once again pinned her under a claw, pressing her onto the ground with its full weight and nearly squeezing all the wind out of her lungs as it pushed against a few of the dimly lit gems in order, causing the wall to shift silently.

Moonbounce wriggled as the dragon crushed her butt, leaving an actual footprint across her rump cheeks as the Thestral was stomped silly. Her butt was like playing with putty, the squishy and doughy flesh splaying and squeezing between toe claws, before the foot finally lifted. The Thestral groaned, when she felt claws grab her hooves. With a squeal she was pulled back, bring dragged across the ground and her belly as she was being pulled somewhere. She tried to plant her forehooves down and wriggle free, but the walk to this secret door was shorter. A moment later she was dropped, and before she could get up and run a massive foot crashed against her back this time, pinning her down and forcing the air out of her as she flattened out against the floor. "S-stop! I'm a guard!" Moonbounce cried.

The dragon chuckled and with the door opening another dragon stepped out, this one larger and more menacing looking. "I caught us a little pony trying to spill our secret ingredients." It stared down at them both, lowering down to the thestral and letting out a snort before nodding and without word the large dragon grabbed onto her with its tail and slung her around in the air as it walked through the dark hall followed by the smaller dragon, "Heh, the boss is not going to like this one bit." a toothy grin said at her.

Moonbounce was still trying to stand, but the dragon's foot was just too heavy for her. She pushed upwards, but only slid that slick sole against her back. Another dragon then stepped out, this one bigger, his scales black and horns clear on his head. He growled down at her, and then crouched above her. "I-I can forget about it!" she squealed, when suddenly a tail lashed around her, binding her up like rope. With a tug she was pulled into the air, it effortlessly binding her as she was dragged behind the large dragon, seeing the small dragon walking behind him, the two facing each other. Moon shook her head, her pleading eyes looking up at the small dragon as she was dragged to meet the boss.

They came to a stop near a large door only barely visible through the gem light and with a loud heave the large dragon pushed it open slowly, revealing what looked like a normal office, only a lot larger than usual. A large dragon sat at on a throne behind the desk, his frame thick and wide as he watched them enter. He looked down at the thestral with a glare, "I was wondering why I was being disturbed. Bring her hear." He sat back in his throne as the comparatively small dragon brought her up and placed her on the desk. His head towering over her, "My, my, it's not often that I get visitors. Tell me, pony, why are you here?"

The group stopped, Moonbounce unable to see where they were going with her body almost entirely bound up in tail, it wrapped around everything but her dangling hooves and head. There was a sudden groan, and then a door opened. She heard a voice, and then was lifted up, shown off. She gasped at the massive dragon that sat perched on what could only be called a throne, his belly spilling over his knees. Moon whimpered as she saw his sharp amber eyes glaring, and then she was thrown out, tossed up and onto his desk, right before him. He glared down at her, laughing at her as he spoke. The thestral whimpered. "I... I... just came for a meal..." she said innocently.

The dragon let out a loud chortle of laughter, his voice booming in the large cave like office, "Well, you must have taken a wrong turn and entered a restricted area. I guess having the hall secluded wasn't enough." He scratched over his large stomach his laughter booming once again. He suddenly reached for her and grabbed her in his claws, squeezing her tightly, "Why are you here?" his voice was still somewhat amused, but his eyes were anything but.

The dragon's chuckled echoed around the entire room, magnifying in a way that made Moonbounce flinch. She shook in fear, faced with such a massive and fat beast. It scratched its belly, making the flabby rolls mash together and shake... then all the laughter was gone. In an instant two claws wrapped around her, squeezing her like a toy, the mare's head swelling up cartoonishly as he crushed her chest. "I saw something suspicious! So I came back and a chef was cooking a pony! I'm a guard, please!" she squealed so fast it was hard to make out what was said without reviewing for a second.

He sighed, "Hmmm, that's odd. I don't remember us ever doing any harm to ponies..." He brought her up to his chest and scratched her along the greasy scales idly. "You must be mistaken. Our establishment is well known for its utmost respect for equestrians as well as the finest service." He held her against his warm body, sliding her up and down, being sure to gather up some of the moisture that had built up around his body.

One of the claws let go, allowing her to breathe again. The mare groaned, when his claw brought her closer to his chest. He rammed her against his sweaty scales, using her body to scratch some itch and making her fur all greasy in the process. The dragon brushed her off even as she sputtered and struggled, trying to push away from his belly as she was squeezed against it. "M-maybe I was," she squealed when he slipped her further down, her body absorbing his sweaty filth like some kind of sponge. "I-I must of been! Y-you never would hurt a pony!" Moon cried desperately.

The dragon brought dragged her along his body, sliding her to his lower abdomen and between the rolls of his large gut to clean up the small caches of collected slimy substances that had built up over time. "I would never hurt a pony, but then again, there's no pony in here is there?" The other dragons chuckled along with him as he pressed her lower between his wide legs the tights pressing against her sides as he was squeezed down, nearing his groin.

The thestral nodded her head, smiling. He was just playing with her and he'd let her go because he wouldn't hurt her. She squealed as he then crammed her right up between his fat rolls, crushing her inside to swab at the filthy dank remnants that had congealed there into gooey slime. She gagged and retched, then heard the other half of his comment. "N-no! I'm right here! Please! I won't tell a soul!" Moon cried as the dragon used her to sponge all of his fat rolls, soaking her in greasy mess.
